net.trajano.wagon.git.internal

Class GitUri

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.trajano.wagon.git.internal.GitUri

  • public class GitUri
extends Object
    Git URI. This provides the logic to extract the components from a URI. The URI string is in the form git:gitSpecificUri?branchName#relativeDirectory.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private String branchName
      Branch name.
      private String gitRepositoryUri
      Repository URI.
      private String resource
      Resource.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

        GitUri(String gitRepositoryUri, String branchName, String resource)
      Constructs the URI based on the parts.
      private GitUri(URI gitUri) 

    • Method Summary

      Git repository URI.

    • Field Detail

      • branchName

        private final String branchName
        Branch name.

        private final String resource
        Resource. This is the fragment part of the URI.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GitUri

        public GitUri(String gitRepositoryUri,
      String branchName,
      String resource)
        Constructs the URI based on the parts.
        Parameters:
        gitRepositoryUri - git repository URL.
        branchName - branch name usually "gh-pages"
        resource - resource

      • GitUri

        private GitUri(URI gitUri)
        Parameters:
        gitUri - valid git URI (i.e. no git: schema).

    • Method Detail

      • getBranchName

        public String getBranchName()
        Branch name.
        Returns:
        branch name

      • getGitRepositoryUri

        public String getGitRepositoryUri()
        Git repository URI. This returns a string as that is what is being used by the JGit API.
        Returns:
        Git repository URI

      • getResource

        public String getResource()

      • resolve

        public GitUri resolve(String fragment)
        Resolves a new GitUri with the fragment. The schema portion will find the last occurrence of a URI path segment with a "?" character as the Git URI with the branch name.
        Parameters:
        fragment - may contain escaped characters.
        Returns:
        resolved GitUri
